ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is designed to show how individual cells can work together to create complex tissue behavior.I would not recommend it to another student because I felt like since it was so instructor dependent it would have been more time efficient for me to just read several reviews on the topic.

Yes because it was a good review of things I had been introduced to in a previous course but at the same time it went into deeper detail on those same topics but in a more research-based focus, as opposed to a textbook-style course that only tells the facts or discoveries instead of how the information was discovered scientifically.

The class offers a survey of the major organs/systems of the human body from the cellular level, and in most cases provides information on recent work in the field. I would recommend the class. Even though each topic could not be covered in a great amount of detail, I found the class very useful and interesting.
A class that touched on every system of the physiological system, very good structured and well organized lectures.

It's a course on human physiology that approaches from the cellular level. If that's a subject relevant to one's research, or even just an area that one ought to brush up on, I would certainly recommend the course.
if you are interested in histology, you may choose the course.
A useful introduction to cellular structure and function in different organ systems. I would recommend this class.

A great refresher of the basic organ systems with an clinical perspective and introduction to the molecular mechanisms involved in normal and abnormal functioning. The histology component is a great partner to the lectures.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Had researchers from my specific field speak and helped me think of things to consider for my research project, gave me a better idea of the larger picture and what point in the field my research fits in.
Yes, very helpful for understanding disease mechanisms and pathology.
It gave me a broader understanding of the cellular networks that contribute to proper function of the human body. Vascular topics were relevant to my research.
